title: Tennessee governor signs transgender sports bill into law requiring students to prove their sex at birth
description: Tennessee Governor Bill Lee signed a transgender sports bill into law Friday requiring students to prove their sex at birth in order to play in middle and high school sports.

title: Polls say Americans report record low opinions of China. Are the surveys measuring racism?
description: This year, Americans said they really, really don't like China.

title: More than 30 killed as two trains collide in Egypt
description: At least 32 people were killed and 66 injured after two trains collided in the Tahta district of the Upper Egypt governorate of Sohag, the Egyptian Ministry of Health said Friday.

title: Tapper rolls the tape after Trump's false riot claim
description: CNN's Jake Tapper debunks Trump's false claim that Capitol rioters were "hugging and kissing" police.

title: 'It's not a safe place': Thierry Henry quits social media, hoping to inspire others to stand up to online abuse
description: Former France international Thierry Henry says he hopes his decision to step away from social media will inspire others to stand up against racist abuse and bullying online.

title: Volcanologist shares what he prefers to cook on lava flows
description: Planetary Volcanologist Christopher Hamilton gives Anderson Cooper tips for cooking on lava. Watch "Full Circle" every Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.

title: He heard what he believed was someone loading guns in a bathroom stall. Police arrested a man with 6 guns
description: An Instacart shopper who entered an Atlanta supermarket bathroom this week told police he saw an AR-15 style rifle and heard what he believed was the sound of someone loading guns in a bathroom stall.

title: Aerial videos show the devastation after historic floods in Australia
description: Clean up efforts are underway after torrential rains and floods inundated parts of the country for days, leaving at least one person dead and extensive damage behind.

title: Sanctioned UK politician compares Beijing's Xinjiang policies to Nazis
description: Beijing has issued more retaliatory sanctions over Xinjiang, targeting individuals and entities in the United Kingdom it says "maliciously spread lies and disinformation" regarding Beijing's treatment of Uyghur Muslims. CNN's Lynda Kinkade speaks with British MP Iain Duncan Smith, one of several UK politicians sanctioned by China.

title: Why the Suez Canal's blockage could be so damaging
Boycotting Qatar World Cup would be 'big mistake,' says Belgium manager
description: As players continue to protest the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar, Belgium manager Roberto Martínez says boycotting the tournament would be a "big mistake."

title: Lewis Hamilton 'spoken to Bahrain officials' about human rights issues ahead of F1 race in country
description: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton has said he's "spoken to Bahrain officials" about alleged human rights abuses in the country ahead of the Grand Prix in the country.

title: Labor board orders Musk to delete a 3-year-old anti-union tweet
description: Elon Musk's tweets have once again come under fire from federal regulators.

title: China slaps duties of up to 218% on Australian wine for 5 years
description: China is slapping massive duties on wine from Australia for the next five years, a move that threatens to deprive the country's winemakers of their top export market and escalate a trade dispute.

title: Members of Congress may use campaign funds to hire bodyguards, FEC rules
description: Members of Congress can use campaign funds to hire bodyguards, federal election regulators ruled Thursday -- nearly three months after the violent January 6 siege on the US Capitol raised fresh concerns about lawmakers' safety.

title: Hubble spies colorful change of seasons on Saturn
description: Earth isn't the only planet that experiences a changing of the seasons. The Hubble Space Telescope has revealed the colorful transition from summer to fall in Saturn's northern hemisphere -- a change years in the making.

title: Trump lies about Capitol riot by claiming his supporters were 'hugging and kissing' cops
description: Former President Donald Trump on Thursday attempted to whitewash the history of the January 6 Capitol riot by pushing the false suggestion that his supporters were "hugging and kissing" police officers and posed "zero threat" despite widespread violence, injuries to law enforcement officers and five deaths.

title: Scientists probe whether recent Ebola outbreak was from man who survived epidemic five years ago
description: Scientists and global health officials are investigating whether the current Ebola outbreak in Guinea may have been triggered by a person who was first infected with the virus during the Ebola epidemic in the region five years ago.

title: Trump praises Capitol rioters during a phone interview with Fox News
description: Former President Donald Trump praised the US Capitol rioters during a phone interview with Fox News. CNN's Brian Stelter says Trump's attempt to rewrite history is a "shame on the conscience of the country."

title: Sister Jean, the 101-year-old basketball-loving nun, on praying for her favorite team
description: Every team needs a good luck charm and for Loyola University Chicago's basketball team, it comes in the form of the beloved Sister Jean.

title: 'The Irregulars' spins out Sherlock Holmes' sidekicks with an 'X-Files' twist
description: There have been so many variations on Sherlock Holmes that the idea of another -- especially built around teenagers -- didn't provoke much enthusiasm going in. But "The Irregulars" proves unexpectedly fun, in what amounts to a Victorian version of "The X-Files," revising the most familiar characters while introducing a major dose of the supernatural to Baker Street.

title: Ex-CDC boss believes Covid came from China lab; he cites no clear evidence
description: This past January, just a few days after the inauguration of President Joe Biden, six of the doctors responsible for the previous administration's Covid-19 response agreed to sit down -- in strict confidence --  and talk with me about the events of the past year.

title: 'It's a matter of timing': Biden lays out expansive theory of his own presidency
Chinese celebrities rush to defend Beijing's Xinjiang policy by cutting ties with international brands
description: Chinese celebrities are finding it increasingly difficult to stay out of politics.

title: Dramatic video shows inside the tornado in Alabama
description: Pelham, Alabama, resident Cesar Villaseñor captured dramatic footage from inside a tornado that struck the area Thursday.

title: H&M and Nike are facing a boycott in China
description: H&M, Nike and other big Western apparel brands are facing a boycott in China because of the stand they've taken against the alleged use of forced labor to produce cotton in the country's western region of Xinjiang.

title: Up to 706,000 cubic feet of sand needs to be removed from the Suez Canal to liberate the stranded Ever Given container ship, officials estimate
description: • A huge ship is blocking a vital trade artery. It could get costly

title: Grieving family of young girl shot dead by Myanmar's military forced into hiding
description: The family of a young girl killed in her home by Myanmar's security forces say they have gone into hiding and dare not return for fear of being targeted by the military.

title: Georgia's new law suppressing the vote is a victory for Trump
description: Former President Donald Trump's campaign of lies about a stolen election just delivered a huge victory with a new Georgia law that could suppress the votes of many of the citizens who helped eject him from the White House.

title: China sanctions UK lawmakers and entities in retaliation for Xinjiang measures
description: China has issued more retaliatory sanctions over Xinjiang, targeting individuals and entities in the United Kingdom it says "maliciously spread lies and disinformation" regarding Beijing's treatment of Uyghur Muslims.

title: She became an online influencer for her anti-vaccination stance. Now she wants a Covid-19 shot
description: Heather Simpson had a following online due to her anti-vaccine beliefs. Now, she worries the anti-vaccine misinformation she promoted hurt other children. She explains her change of heart to CNN Business' Donie O'Sullivan.

title: Georgia Democratic Rep. arrested protesting voting bill
description: Democratic Rep. Park Cannon was arrested for protesting Georgia's sweeping elections bill, which would restrict voting access and give state officials more powers over local elections.

title: Hong Kong Disneyland's new castle is an architectural vision of diversity
description: Much has changed in the 55 years since Walt Disney died -- not just in the fortunes of his brand, now one of the world's most influential corporations, but in the characters it creates and the values it promotes.

title: Fact-checking Biden's first news conference as president
description:
• Key takeaways from the news conference
• See Kaitlan Collins' tough question for Biden
• Biden says US faces battle to 'prove democracy works' against China's autocracy

title: Jessica Walter, 'Arrested Development' star, dies at 80
description: Jessica Walter, an award-winning actress beloved for her role in the television series "Arrested Development," died Wednesday in her sleep at her home in New York City, her daughter confirmed in a statement to CNN.

title: At least 111 people died from the winter storm that hit Texas in February
description: The number of people reported dead in the aftermath of winter storms that pummeled Texas in February now stands at 111, according to the Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS).

title: Man receives over 500 pounds of oily pennies as last paycheck
description: Guy gets paid in 504 pounds of pennies ... oily, smelly pennies. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on pennies even a penny pincher wouldn't love.
